intro: Foetidia dracaenoides, commonly known as the striped dracaena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking, variegated leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. Foetidia dracaenoides thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers indirect sunlight.
